inclusion.criterion: spinal cord injury and/or chronic, irreversible neuropathic bladder dysfunction from other progressive neurological syndromes including Stroke, multiple sclerosis and Parkinsonism.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: minimum duration of injury and bladder dysfunction of 2 years
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: utilize an indwelling Foley catheter, an indwelling suprapubic catheter, diapers or external (condom) catheter drainage or intermittent self-catheterization but finds the current alternative to be socially unsatisfactory.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: recognize the investigational nature of the 'tissue bonding cystostomy' device and must be willing to return for periodic follow-up.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: willing and capable of signing the Informed Consent Document (ICD).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: English-speaking subjects will be accepted for participation.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: reversible spinal cord injury or a reversible neurological illness
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: acceptable forms of urological management utilizing intermittent self-catheterization, or spontaneous voiding with the use of an external collecting appliance.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: advanced neuropathic bladder dysfunction of less than 2 years duration
exclusion.label: met

notes: Patient has a history of CVA, neurogenic bladder with indwelling suprapubic catheter and multiple prior admissions for UTIs. They are currently on ditropan and detrol.
